excerpt: This recipe combines crispy tofu with a mix of flavorful vegetables, all tossed together in a spicy stir-fry sauce. It's a delicious and healthy dish that's easy to make and perfect for busy weeknights.

instructions.name: Prepare the Tofu
instructions: Press the tofu for at least 15 minutes to remove any excess water.
Cut the tofu into bite-sized cubes.
In a bowl, mix together the cornstarch, salt, and pepper.
Add the tofu to the bowl and toss to coat.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the tofu to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes per side, or until crispy and golden brown.
Remove the tofu from the pan and set aside.

instructions.name: Cook the Vegetables
instructions: Heat the remaining tablespoon of oil in the same pan over medium heat.
Add the bell pepper, onion, and carrots to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until slightly softened.
Add the broccoli to the pan and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Remove the vegetables from the pan and set aside.

instructions.name: Make the Stir-Fry Sauce
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, and sriracha.

instructions.name: Combine Everything
instructions: Add the tofu and vegetables back to the pan over medium heat.
Pour the stir-fry sauce over the tofu and vegetables and stir to combine.
Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the tofu and vegetables are coated.
Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds before serving.
